SourceText: {F3_MOTHER} is a single mother of young children. She often feels that between work, parenting, and managing the home, she does not have enough time for her children. She wants to spend more time with {F3_SON_7}, her middle child.
text: {F3_MOTHER} merupakan seorang ibu tunggal dan mempunyai anak-anak yang masih kecil. Dia merasakan bahawa dia tidak mempunyai masa untuk anak-anaknya, kerana masanya banyak dihabiskan untuk bekerja, tugas keibubapaan dan menguruskan rumah tangga. Dia ingin meluangkan lebih banyak masa bersama anak keduanya iaitu {F3_SON_7}.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: What is it, {F3_SON_7}? Are you okay?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Apa yang berlaku, {F3_SON_7}? Kamu baik-baik sahaja?

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: Every other kid in my class had a parent attend the school performance today and you were not there! I hate that you have to work all the time. It is not fair!
text: {F3_SON_7}: Semua ibu bapa rakan saya di sekolah menghadiri persembahan di sekolah hari ini tetapi ibu tidak hadir! Saya rasakan ia tidak adil kerana ibu sering bekerja setiap masa!

SourceText: (Thinking...)
text: (Berfikir...)

SourceText: - Iâ€™m trying my best.
text: - Saya sedang cuba sedaya upaya.

SourceText: - Trying to make ends meet and raise three children alone is very difficult.
text: - Hidup kais pagi makan pagi, kais petang makan petang untuk membesarkan tiga anak seorang diri sangat sukar.

SourceText: - Other parents find this hard too. Iâ€™m not alone.
text: - Bukan saya seorang yang begini, ibu bapa yang lain merasakan kesukaran yang sama.

SourceText: - This is not the last school performance. There will be other opportunities to show up for {F3_SON_7}.
text: - Ini bukan persembahan sekolah yang terakhir buat {F3_SON_7}. Mesti ada peluang lain untuk saya hadir sama.

SourceText: - Things have been very difficult lately, and I need to take some time out to look after myself.
text: - Sejak kebelakangan ini, saya perlukan sedikit masa untuk menjaga diri sendiri kerana keadaan begitu sulit bagi saya.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: My {F3_SON_7}, you practised so hard for this performance. I am sorry I could not get out of work. Can you give me my own performance after dinner? I cannot wait to see how brilliant you are!
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kamu telah berlatih dengan bersungguh-sungguh untuk persembahan ini, {F3_SON_7}. Maafkan Ibu kerana Ibu perlu bekerja. Bolehkah kamu membuat persembahan di hadapan Ibu selepas makan malam? Ibu juga ingin melihat betapa bijaknya anak Ibu ini!

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: Thanks, Mama.
text: {F3_SON_7}: Terima kasih, Ibu.

SourceText: ğŸ˜£ Sometimes, it seems easier to ignore negative feelings so they will go away.

SourceText: â—But ignoring them only means they will come up later or get worse!

SourceText: ğŸš© When you feel any negative emotion, notice what you are feeling.

SourceText: ğŸ’› Now, say to yourself, â€œItâ€™s OK,â€ because it is OK to have negative feelings. Everyone does sometimes!

SourceText: ğŸ˜” Often, these feelings come up for a good reason and can tell us something. It really is OK!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} wants his young children to learn about respect for their elders. His parents taught him to respect his elders and he wants his children to do the same. Letâ€™s see how {F1_FATHER} and his wife, {F1_MOTHER} discuss their parenting values.
text: {F1_FATHER} mahu anak-anaknya yang masih kecil untuk belajar menghormati orang yang lebih tua. Ibu bapanya mengajarkan hal yang sama dan mahu anaknya mengikuti jejaknya. Mari kita lihat bagaimana {F1_FATHER} dan isterinya, {F1_MOTHER} berbincang tentang nilai keibubapaan mereka.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: When I was playing with our kids earlier, they raised their voices at me and I was shocked.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Saya terkejut kerana anak-anak kita meninggikan suara pada saya ketika saya bermain dengan mereka sebentar tadi.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Hmm, maybe they were trying to tell you something with excitement.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Hmm, mungkin mereka sedang teruja dan pada masa yang sama, mereka ingin memberitahu kamu sesuatu.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Hmm, maybe. When I was young, my parents never allowed me to speak loudly to them. It is a sign of respect for elders.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Hmm, mungkin juga. Semasa saya kecil, ibu bapa saya tidak pernah membenarkan saya meninggikan suara kepada mereka. Itu maksudnya tidak hormat akan orang tua.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: I think that respect for elders is very important and a good tradition to pass down to our kids. We also want our kids to be open with their feelings.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Menyemai sikap hormat terhadap orang tua memang penting dan tradisi ini perlu diturunkan kepada anak kita. Walaubagaimanapun, kita juga mahu anak-anak kita bersikap terbuka tentang perasaan mereka.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Thatâ€™s true. We can help our kids to express themselves while still being respectful.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Betul. Kita boleh bantu anak-anak kita luahkan perasaan tapi dalam masa yang sama tetap menghormati orang lain.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Exactly!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Tepat sekali!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} is a dad committed to positive parenting. Letâ€™s see how he approaches time with his son, {F1_SON_5}:
text: {F1_FATHER} ialah ayah yang bersungguh-sungguh ingin menerapkan keibubapaan positif. Mari kita lihat bagaimana dia memanfaatkan masa bersama anaknya, {F1_SON_5}:

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I see you are playing quietly with the blocks with concentration, {F1_SON_5}.
text: {F1_FATHER}: {F1_SON_5}, Ayah lihat kamu bermain lego dengan tenang dan penuh tumpuan.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Wow! You are building such a tall and strong wall with those blocks.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Wah! Kamu membina tembok yang tinggi dan kukuh dengan lego-lego itu.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: It is for cows.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Ini untuk kandang lembu.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: It will keep the cows safe!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Lembu-lembu itu pasti selamat!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Now you can help me build a house for our family to sleep in!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Sekarang bolehlah Ayah tolong saya bina rumah untuk keluarga kita!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: This house is going to keep our family warm and dry. You are such a good builder, {F1_SON_5}!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Rumah ni akan melindungi keluarga kita daripada panas dan hujan. {F1_SON_5}, kamu memang jurubina yang hebat!

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ ASK

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Help your child to talk more by asking questions that donâ€™t have just â€˜yesâ€™ or â€˜noâ€™ answers.
text: ğŸ’¡ Bantu anak anda bercakap lebih banyak dengan bertanyakan soalan terbuka yang tidak mempunyai jawapan sama ada 'ya' atau 'tidak'.

SourceText: âœ¨ Ask questions like, â€œWhat would you like to do with your friend later?â€ or, â€œDid you do anything special in school today?â€
text: âœ¨ Tanyakan soalan seperti, "Apa yang kamu ingin lakukan bersama kawan kamu nanti?" atau, "Adakah kamu melakukan apa-apa yang istimewa di sekolah hari ini?"

SourceText: â° Give them time to respond - they may need time to think and express, especially if they are giving longer answers!
text: â° Mungkin anak anda perlukan masa untuk berfikir dan meluahkan, terutamanya jika dia memberi jawapan yang lebih panjang - oleh itu, berinya masa untuk bertindak balas!

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ After giving them time, if it is difficult for them to say what they want, you can help them with prompts!

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ BUILD

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚Listen to your child and always respond.
text: ğŸ‘‚Dengar anak anda dan sentiasa bertindak balas.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Confirm what they said and add more to help them connect their understanding to new language. For example, if your child says, â€œThereâ€™s a cat,â€ you could respond, â€œYes, thereâ€™s a cat making a big hole in the groundâ€.
text: ğŸ”„Untuk membantu anak anda mengaitkan pemahamannnya dalam bahasa yang baharu, sahkan apa yang dia katakan dan tambahkan maklumat lanjut. Sebagai contoh, jika anak anda berkata, "Ada kucing," anda boleh membalas, "Ya, ada kucing sedang buat lubang besar di tanah".

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ TELL STORIES
text: 5ï¸âƒ£ BERCERITA

SourceText: ğŸˆ Tell your child stories! They can be real, made up, about your lives, or read to them from books.
text: ğŸˆ Ceritakan sebuah kisah kepada anak anda! Cerita tersebut boleh jadi kisah benar, rekaan semata-mata, berkisarkan kehidupan anda, atau anda juga boleh bacakan mana-mana buku kepada anak anda.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ Encourage your child to tell stories too. You could show photos and create a story together!

SourceText: â­ Our first lesson today is about enjoying books with your child.
text: â­ Pelajaran pertama kita pada hari ini ialah tentang menghayati buku dengan anak anda.

SourceText: Reading with your child is the best way to help your child learn to read. ğŸ“–ğŸ‰
text: Membaca dengan anak anda ialah cara yang terbaik untuk bantu anak anda belajar membaca. ğŸ“–ğŸ‰

SourceText: Children learn by watching, listening, and copying. When you read to them when they are little, they learn new words. Later they learn letters and letter sounds, and when theyâ€™re bigger, reading together can help them learn about anything they are interested in! ğŸ’¡
text: Membaca dengan anak ialah cara yang terbaik untuk membantu anak anda membaca. Kanak-kanak belajar dengan melihat, mendengar, dan meniru. Apabila anda membaca kepada mereka semasa mereka kecil, mereka belajar perkataan baharu. Kemudian, mereka akan mempelajari huruf dan bunyi huruf, dan apabila mereka besar, membaca bersama akan membantu mereka belajar apa yang mereka minat!ğŸ’¡

SourceText: Letâ€™s see how {F1_FATHER} reads with his son, {F1_SON_5}. Notice how he uses the pictures in the book to teach.
text: Mari kita lihat bagaimana {F1_FATHER} membaca dengan anak lelakinya, {F1_SON_5}. Perhatikan bagaimana dia mengajar dengan menggunakan gambar-gambar yang ada dalam buku.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Wow, this book looks interesting! Can you see the picture? It has a tiger who is smiling. What do you think the book is about?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Wah, buku ini nampak menarik! Tengok gambar harimau yang sedang tersenyum. Rasanya, buku ini tentang apa?

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Wow, what is happening here? What is the tiger holding?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Wah, harimau ini sedang pegang apa? Apa yang berlaku?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: A balloon!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Belon!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Thatâ€™s right, it's a balloon, what colour is it?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Betul! Apakah warna belon itu?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Red!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Merah!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Yes, itâ€™s a red balloon! Why do you think the tiger is holding the red balloon? Do you think itâ€™s his birthday? Yes! The tiger is holding the red balloon because itâ€™s his birthday!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Ya, itu belon merah! Kenapa harimau itu pegang belon warna merah? Adakah kerana hari ini hari lahirnya? Ya! Harimau itu pegang belon merah kerana hari ini hari lahirnya!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: What is the first sound of â€œballoonâ€? â€œBâ€? Thatâ€™s right, this letter makes the sound â€œBâ€! Can you think of any other words that start with â€œBâ€? Yes! â€œBall also starts with â€œBâ€. If you canâ€™t think of any more I can help! What about â€œbasketâ€?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Apa bunyi pertama bagi â€œbelonâ€? â€œBâ€? Betul, huruf ini berbunyi sebagai â€œBâ€! Ada tak perkataan lain yang bermula dengan â€œBâ€? Ya! â€œBola juga bermula dengan â€œBâ€. Ayah boleh bantu jika kamu tidak dapat fikir perkataan lain! Bagaimana dengan â€œbakulâ€?

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Help your child identify â€œbeginning sounds,â€ â€œmiddle sounds,â€ and â€œend soundsâ€ - and letters that make these.

SourceText: You can use what is around you and your daily routines to talk to your child about maths. â° This will help prepare them for success. â­

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ COUNT

SourceText: ğŸ”´ Counting is a skill your child can start to learn early. 1ï¸âƒ£2ï¸âƒ£3ï¸âƒ£

SourceText: ğŸš— Ask your child to count things around you: cars, people, houses, how many steps between one place and another, and their fingers and toes! ğŸ‘‹
text: ğŸš— Minta anak anda untuk mengira apa-apa yang ada di sekeliling anda, seperti kereta, orang-orang yang berada di sekeliling, rumah, berapa langkah untuk tiba ke satu tempat dari tempat yang lain, serta mengira jari kaki dan tangannya! ğŸ‘‹

SourceText: ğŸ… Ask your child to count things in daily activities: count things while cooking, like potatoes, while sorting out clothes, like socks, or while at the supermarket.
text: ğŸ… Anak anda boleh mengira apa-apa sahaja dalam aktiviti harian: mengira bahan-bahan seperti kentang ketika memasak, ketika mengasingkan pakaian seperti stoking, dan juga ketika berada di pasaraya.

SourceText: ğŸµ Sing songs that include numbers with your child.

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ LOOK FOR NUMBERS
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ CARI NOMBOR-NOMBOR

SourceText: ğŸ“±Numbers are all around us if you look for them. Theyâ€™re on food packaging, and even on the TV remote.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Wherever you see a number, ask your child what it is.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ Help them if they donâ€™t know!

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ LEARN WITH SHAPES

SourceText: ğŸ”· Learning about shapes is also important in maths! Shapes are everywhere, too, so find them and talk about them. You could even make them! ğŸ‘€
text: ğŸ”· Dalam matematik, belajar tentang bentuk juga sememangnya penting! Bentuk juga berada di mana-mana, jadi cari bentuk dan bercakap tentang bentuk tersebut. Anda juga boleh membuat bentuk sendiri! ğŸ‘€

SourceText: ğŸ”´ Help your child draw different shapes.

SourceText: ğŸ”µ If you can, cut them out and help your child sort them into groups (by colour, shape, size, or however else your child wants!) Ask them why they are sorting in that way.

SourceText: Home activity! â­ Try to involve your child in an activity with numbers. For example, counting the amount of ingredients when you are cooking. Can you do it today?

SourceText: Letâ€™s see how {F1_MOTHER} is practising numbers with her son, {F1_SON_5} in the kitchen:
text: {F1_MOTHER} sedang berlatih menggunakan nombor di dapur bersama anaknya, {F1_SON_5}. Mari kita lihat bagaimana situasi tersebut:

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thank you for cooking with me! Youâ€™re so helpful! What do you have here?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Kamu sangat membantu! Terima kasih kerana membantu ibu memasak! Apa yang kamu ada di sini?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Potatoes!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Kentang!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thatâ€™s right! Potatoes! How many potatoes do you have?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Betul! Ini kentang! Jadi, berapa biji kentang yang kamu ada?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Five!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Lima!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thatâ€™s right! One, two, three, fourâ€¦ five! Five potatoes!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Betul! Kita kira, satu, dua, tiga, empatâ€¦ dan lima! Ada lima biji kentang!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Can you give me two potatoes?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Boleh berikan 2 biji kentang kepada Ibu?

SourceText: Thatâ€™s right! Oneâ€¦ twoâ€¦!
text: Betul! Satuâ€¦ duaâ€¦!

SourceText: How many potatoes are left?
text: Berapa biji kentang yang tinggal?

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Is it difficult? Donâ€™t worry, letâ€™s count together! Letâ€™s seeâ€¦ we had five, and you gave me two, now there are oneâ€¦ twoâ€¦ three remaining! There are three potatoes left!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Mudah sahaja, bukan? Tidak mengapa, jom kita kira bersama-sama! Tadi... kita ada lima biji kentang, kamu berikan 2 biji kentang, jadi sekarang ada satu... dua... tiga biji yang tinggal! Ada lagi tiga biji kentang!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Three potatoes left!

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ Here are four ways for you to encourage your child to practise his number skills:
text: 4ï¸âƒ£ Empat cara ini dapat membantu anda memberi galakan supaya anak anda dapat berlatih menggunakan kemahiran nombor yang diperoleh:

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Ask your child to help sort things into groups, such as putting all the leaves together when cooking.
text: ğŸŒ± Minta anak anda untuk membantu asingkan sesuatu ke dalam kumpulan, sebagai contoh kumpulkan semua sayur bersama-sama ketika memasak.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ Ask your child to find 5 of something, and then to order them from smallest to biggest. You can use something like sticks.
text: ğŸ˜ƒ Anda boleh menggunakan 5 batang kayu atau objek lain yang boleh dikira dalam aktiviti ini. Kemudian, arahkan anak anda untuk menyusun kayu yang paling kecil hingga yang paling besar.

SourceText: â¬†ï¸ Then order them a different way, like from lightest to darkest!
text: â¬†ï¸ Setelah itu, susun dengan cara lain pula, contohnya daripada yang paling terang hingga yang paling gelap!

SourceText: âœ¨ Help your child think about groups! Say: â€œA potato is a round red vegetable. Can you think of something else that is red like a potato?â€ Then: â€œCan you think of something that is also round but bigger than a potato?â€ âš½
text: âœ¨ Bantu anak anda fikirkan tentang kumpulan! Katakan: â€œKentang ialah sayur kuning dan bulat. Bolehkah kamu fikirkan benda lain yang berwarna kuning seperti kentang?â€ kemudian: â€œBolehkah kamu fikirkan sesuatu yang bulat tetapi lebih besar daripada kentang?â€ âš½

SourceText: â¬†ï¸â¬‡ï¸ Once they know about numbers, your child might be able to start learning about adding and taking away!
text: â¬†ï¸â¬‡ï¸ Anak anda boleh belajar membaca dengan teknik menambah dan mengurangkan jika dia sudah mengenal nombor!

SourceText: ğŸš Use activities similar to counting exercises, like cooking, sorting clothes, shopping, or building things!
text: ğŸš Gunakan aktiviti yang sama dengan latihan mengira, seperti memasak, mengasingkan pakaian, membeli-belah, atau membina sesuatu!

SourceText: ğŸ… Say â€œI have two potatoes. When I add two more, how many do I have?â€ Help your child get the answer! Keep practising and, after a while, make it more difficult!
text: ğŸ… Katakan â€œSaya ada dua biji kentang. Berapa banyak yang saya ada jika saya menambahkan dua lagi biji kentang?â€ Bantu anak anda mendapatkan jawapan! Teruskan berlatih dan tingkatkan kesukaran soalan yang diberi secara beransur-ansur!

SourceText: âš½ Try the activity with different things like balls or shoes.
text: âš½ Gunakan benda yang berlainan seperti bola atau kasut untuk mencuba aktiviti tersebut.

SourceText: â¬‡ï¸ Repeat the activity, but take things away: â€œI have five potatoes. When I take two away, how many do I have?â€
text: â¬‡ï¸ Ulangkan aktiviti tersebut, tetapi dengan cara mengurangkan nombor pula. "Saya mempunyai lima biji kentang. Berapa banyak yang saya ada jika saya mengurangkan dua biji kentang?â€

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Practise anywhere and everywhere! You can also do the game in your imaginations.
text: ğŸ”„ Anda juga boleh bermain permainan seperti ini mengikut imaginasi anda dan berlatih di mana-mana sahaja anda berada.

SourceText: â° Once your child is old enough and has learned some number skills, they can start learning harder skills.
text: â° Anak anda boleh mula mempelajari kemahiran yang lebih sukar jika dia sudah cukup usia dan telah mempelajari beberapa kemahiran nombor.

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ If you think they are ready, ask them to find 5 stones. Show them that you can make 5 stones with one group of 1 stone and another of 4 stones
text: 5ï¸âƒ£ Minta anak anda mencari 5 biji batu jika anda merasakan dia sudah bersedia. Dengan menggunakan 5 biji batu, tunjukkan kepadanya batu-batu tersebut boleh dibahagikan menjadi 1 kumpulan dengan 1 biji batu dan 1 kumpulan lain dengan 4 biji batu

SourceText: then show them with one group of 2 and one group of 3.
text: kemudian tunjukkan kepadanya kumpulan lain di mana terdapat 1 kumpulan dengan 2 biji batu serta 1 kumpulan dengan 3 biji batu.

SourceText: ğŸ”Ÿ When they are ready for more difficult challenges, do the same activity with more stones, up to 10.
text: ğŸ”Ÿ Lakukan aktiviti yang sama dengan lebih banyak batu sehingga 10 biji batu apabila anak anda telah bersedia untuk cabaran yang lebih sukar.

SourceText: ğŸ’š Remember, go slowly and help your child build confidence by doing things that they are ready for and know how to do.
text: ğŸ’š Pastikan anda membantu anak anda membina keyakinan dengan melakukan perkara yang dia sudah bersedia dan mengetahui cara melakukannya serta teruskan dengan rentak yang perlahan.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ Always encourage their effort and praise them. Wrong answers are okay, too!
text: ğŸ˜ƒJawapan yang salah juga tidak mengapa. Oleh itu, sentiasa galakkan usaha anak anda dan beri pujian atas usahanya!

SourceText: ğŸ‰ Try to make learning fun and enjoyable to your child. It will make them more likely to keep trying.
text: ğŸ‰ Ubah proses pembelajaran anak anda menjadi lebih mengujakan dan menyeronokkan. Secara tidak langsung, ia akan membuatkan anak anda lebih cenderung untuk terus mencuba.

SourceText: Home activity! â­ Can you do an activity with adding and taking away with your child? You can do that while cooking with them again, or with other objects - like playing outside with stones!
text: Aktiviti di rumah! â­ Bolehkah anda melakukan satu aktiviti yang melibatkan aktiviti menambah dan mengurangkan bersama anak anda? Anda boleh melakukannya sambil memasak bersamanya sekali lagi, atau dengan objek lain - contohnya bermain di luar menggunakan batu!

SourceText: Great! ğŸ’™ These activities will help your child learn!

SourceText: That's OK! If you don't have time today, try to do some adding and taking away activities with your child tomorrow.

SourceText: ğŸ“–This skill is about helping your child learn skills to prepare them for reading when they are older. â­
text: ğŸ“–Ini adalah kemahiran untuk membantu anak anda mempelajari kemahiran yang akan mempersiapkannya untuk membaca apabila dia sudah besar nanti. â­

SourceText: Reading with your child is the best way to help your child learn to read. ğŸ”‘
text: Untuk membantu anak anda belajar membaca, cara yang terbaik adalah dengan membaca bersama anak anda!. ğŸ”‘

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} is trying to put on his shoes.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Let me put your shoes on

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: No, I want to do it myself!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Okay, {F1_SON_5}, you can do it yourself.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I canâ€™t do it!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Okay.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Okey.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Hold your shoe in both your hands. Now, place your left foot in the shoe. Almost there! Wiggle your toes and make sure your heel is all the way in. Good job! Now, you try with your right shoe.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I did it!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Great job, {F1_SON_5}! You are getting to be such a big boy!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I want to do it now!!

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: No, I want to do it first!!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: It can be hard to wait but we cannot all go first. {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, how about you suggest a way for us to take turns kicking the ball?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Memang susah nak sabar dan tunggu giliran, tapi kita tak boleh tendang satu bola ini pada masa yang serentak, kan? {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, apa kata kamu berikan cadangan supaya kita boleh cuba menendang bola ini secara bergilir-gilir?

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: Okay! How about we make a circle, and I kick the ball to {F1_SON_5}, then he kicks it to you Ayah, and you kick it back to me!
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: Okey! Apa kata kita buat bulatan dan saya tendang bola ini pada {F1_SON_5}, lepas itu dia tendang bola ini pada Ayah dan Ayah tendang bola ini balik kepada saya!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Yes, that sounds cool!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Ya, itu sangat bijak!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Thatâ€™s a fantastic idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Letâ€™s give it a try!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Bernas idea tu, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Jom kita cuba!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Good job, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! You led the way, and we all had so much fun taking turns! {F1_SON_5}, you were also great at patiently waiting for your turn.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Syabas, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Kamu yang beri cadangan ini dan kita sangat seronok mendapat giliran masing-masing untuk menendang bola! {F1_SON_5}, kamu sangat hebat kerana sabar menunggu giliran.

SourceText: Before you can care for your child, you must first care for yourself. ğŸŒ·
text: Anda perlu menjaga diri anda sendiri sebelum anda boleh menjaga anak anda. ğŸŒ·

SourceText: Press play to learn 3ï¸âƒ£ three tips for managing your stress
text: Tekan butang main untuk mempelajari 3ï¸âƒ£ tiga petua tentang cara mengurus tekanan anda

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ REFLECT
text: 1ï¸âƒ£ RENUNGKAN

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ IDENTIFY
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ KENAL PASTI

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ ROUTINE
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ JADUAL HARIAN

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ Here are three steps to help you manage your stress:
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ Berikut adalah tiga langkah untuk membantu anda menguruskan tekanan:

SourceText: ğŸ“ Grab a pen and piece of paper.
text: ğŸ“ Dapatkan sebatang pen dan juga sehelai kertas.

SourceText: â¸ Take a moment to think about how much stress you are feeling.
text: â¸ Ambil masa sebentar untuk berfikir tentang seberapa banyak tekanan yang anda rasakan.

SourceText: â­ Write down from 0 to 100 how stressed you are.
text: â­ Tuliskan sejauh mana anda berasa tertekan daripada skala 0 hingga 100.

SourceText: â“ How does stress feel for you? Do you feel tense, do you have low energy? Are you finding it hard to sleep and focus, or like everything is too much? Write these down.
text: â“ Apa yang anda fikirkan tentang tekanan yang anda hadapi? Tuliskan semua yang anda hadapi. Adakah anda berasa tegang, atau berasa lesu dan tidak bermaya? Adakah anda menghadapi kesukaran untuk tidur dan memberi tumpuan, atau segala-galanya seperti menyesakkan dada anda.

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Knowing how your body responds to stress can help you manage it.
text: ğŸŒ± Anda boleh bantu badan anda bertindak balas dan menguruskan tekanan dengan mengetahui bagaimana badan anda bertindak balas terhadapnya.

SourceText: ğŸš© Write down the main stressors in your life.
text: ğŸš© Tuliskan sebab-sebab utama yang menyebabkan tekanan dalam hidup anda.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Knowing why you feel stress can help you address the stressor and learn how to cope and manage it.
text: ğŸ’¡ Mengetahui mengapa anda merasa tertekan dapat membantu anda mengatasi penyebab tekanan tersebut dan belajar bagaimana menghadapi dan mengurusnya.

SourceText: ğŸ¨ Now identify what activities make you happy. What do you enjoy doing?
text: ğŸ¨ Sekarang, apa yang anda suka lakukan? Kenal pasti aktiviti yang membuatkan anda gembira.

SourceText: ğŸ’š There are different things you can do to care for yourself, such as walking, praying, and reading. Activities that help you manage stress are called â€˜self-care.â€™
text: ğŸ’š Jaga diri anda dengan melakukan perkara seperti berjalan, sembahyang dan membaca. Aktiviti yang membantu anda menguruskan tekanan dipanggil â€˜penjagaan kendiri.â€™

SourceText: âœ¨ Reflect on your daily life: how can you reduce your stress?
text: âœ¨ Renungkan kehidupan seharian anda: bagaimana anda mengurangkan tekanan anda?

SourceText: â˜• How many self-care activities can you fit in your routine?
text: â˜• Berapa banyak aktiviti penjagaan kendiri yang anda boleh masukkan dalam jadual harian anda?

SourceText: â° Try and make time for at least one self-care activity a day.
text: â° Usahakan untuk meluangkan masa melakukan sekurang-kurangnya satu aktiviti penjagaan diri setiap hari.

SourceText: âœ…â¬œï¸
text: âœ…â¬œï¸

SourceText: Home Activity! Write down a list of activities that you can do for yourself that bring you joy. They can be something simple like going for a walk or chatting with a friend. ğŸ’š
text: Aktiviti di Rumah! Senaraikan aktiviti yang menggembirakan dan boleh dilakukan sendiri. Ia boleh menjadi sesuatu yang mudah seperti berjalan-jalan atau bersembang dengan rakan. ğŸ’š

SourceText: Thatâ€™s great! The happier and better you feel, the better parent you will be.
text: Bagus! Anda akan menjadi ibu bapa yang lebih baik jika anda berasa lebih gembira dan lebih baik.

SourceText: Thatâ€™s okay. Try to do it soon. The happier and better you feel, the better parent you will be.
text: Tidak mengapa. Cuba lakukannya nanti. Anda akan menjadi ibu bapa yang lebih baik jika anda berasa lebih gembira dan lebih baik.

SourceText: Todayâ€™s skill is all about how to help your child follow instructions. ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Kemahiran pada hari ini adalah tentang cara untuk membantu anak anda mengikut arahan. ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: Even the best behaved children only follow instructions about 50% of the time. â°
text: Bahkan kanak-kanak yang paling baik kelakuannya hanya 50% mengikut arahan. â°

SourceText: Being more effective about how we give instructions can make things more peaceful and calm at home. ğŸŒ±
text: Cara kita memberi arahan dengan lebih berkesan dapat membuatkan keadaan menjadi lebih aman dan tenang di rumah. ğŸŒ±

SourceText: True or false: It does not matter whether you give an instruction in a positive or negative way.
text: Betul atau salah: Memberi arahan dalam cara yang positif dan negatif tidak memberi kesan apa-apa.

SourceText: Children are more likely to follow an instruction when it is worded in a positive way.
text: Apabila arahan diberikan dalam cara yang positif, kanak-kanak lebih cenderung untuk mengikut arahan.

SourceText: ğŸ’™ Negative instructions like, â€œDonâ€™t do that!â€ can make children (and us) feel bad ğŸ˜£
text: ğŸ’™ Kanak-kanak (dan kita juga) akan rasa bersalah jika arahan yang negatif diberikan seperti "Jangan lakukannya!" ğŸ˜£

SourceText: {F3_DAUGTHER_4} is playing with the handphone on the floor.
text: {F3_DAUGTHER_4} sedang bermain telefon di lantai.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: It is nice to see you playing quietly with the handphone while I clear up after dinner, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the handphone back to me.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Seronok melihat kamu bermain dengan tenang bersama telefon sementara Ibu mengemas meja makan, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. 3 minit lagi sudah waktu tidur, nanti beri semula telefon tersebut kepada Ibu ya.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay, Mummy.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Baik, Ibu.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: {after 3 minutes] 3 minutes is over, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Please give me back the phone.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: {selepas 3 minit] 3 minit telah tamat, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Beri semula telefon kepada Ibu.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okey.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Thank you very much for giving me the phone when I asked you, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Because you listened so well, I will read you an extra story tonight.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Terima kasih, {F3_DAUGHTER_4} sebab memulangkan telefon ketika Ibu minta. Disebabkan kamu mendengar cakap, Ibu akan bacakan cerita tambahan malam nanti.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Yay!
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Yey!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Once upon a timeâ€¦
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Pada zaman dahuluâ€¦

SourceText: This video teaches you 3ï¸âƒ£ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
text: Video ini mengajar anda 3ï¸âƒ£ tiga petua untuk membantu anak anda mengikut arahan dengan lebih kerap

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ BE SPECIFIC
text: 1ï¸âƒ£ JADI SPESIFIK

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ BE REALISTIC
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ JADI REALISTIK

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ BE POSITIVE
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ BERSIKAP POSITIF

SourceText: This audio message teaches you 3ï¸âƒ£ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
text: Mesej audio ini mengajar anda 3ï¸âƒ£ tiga petua untuk membantu anak anda mengikut arahan dengan lebih kerap

SourceText: â­Say the behaviour you want your child to do. For example: â€œPlease take your shoes off when you come inside, Adam.â€
text: â­Sebutkan tingkah laku yang anda mahu anak anda lakukan. Contohnya: "Adam, tolong buka kasut kamu apabila masuk ke dalam rumah."

SourceText: ğŸ‘€Use your childâ€™s name to get your childâ€™s attention. Go down to their level. Get their eye contact.
text: ğŸ‘€Sebut nama anak anda untuk mendapatkan perhatiannya. Rendahkan badan anda pada paras ketinggian anak anda dan pandang matanya.

SourceText: â­Make sure that the instruction is something that your child can do.
text: â­Pastikan anak anda boleh melakukan sesuatu perkara mengikut arahan anda.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡Give one instruction at a time. It can be difficult for your child to remember many instructions!
text: ğŸ’¡Ia mungkin sukar bagi anak anda untuk mengingati banyak arahan. Oleh itu, berikan satu arahan pada satu-satu masa!

SourceText: â°If possible, give a transition warning: â€œIn 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the cellphone back to me.â€
text: â°Beri peringatan tentang peralihan yang akan berlaku jika boleh. "Dalam 3 minit, waktu untuk kamu tidur dan kamu perlu berikan telefon bimbit semula kepada saya."

SourceText: â­Use positive words when giving instructions. For example, instead of â€œDonâ€™t shout,â€ say â€œTalk in a quiet voice.â€
text: â­Gunakan perkataan yang positif ketika memberi arahan. Contohnya, daripada berkata "Jangan jerit," katakan "Cakap dengan suara yang perlahan."

SourceText: ğŸ’¡Give instructions in a firm voice and stay calm. Behave as if you expect your child to do what you ask.
text: ğŸ’¡Berikan arahan dengan suara tegas dan kekal tenang, serta bersikap seolah-olah anda mengharapkan anak anda melakukan apa yang disuruh.

SourceText: ğŸPraise, praise, praise! Make sure you praise your child immediately when they follow your instruction.
text: ğŸPuji, puji, puji! Pastikan anda terus memuji anak anda apabila mereka mengikut arahan anda.

SourceText: ğŸŒ·Also, be kind to yourself if you forget sometimes. Learning how to give positive instructions is not easy, but it works! ğŸ’™
text: ğŸŒ·Selain itu, tidak mengapa jika kadang-kadang anda lupa, berlaku baik terhadap diri sendiri. Bukanlah perkara yang mudah untuk belajar cara untuk memberi arahan yang positif, tetapi ia sememangnya berkesan! ğŸ’™

SourceText: Home activity! â­Try to give specific, realistic, and positive instructions with your child. Do you have time to do this today? â°
text: Aktiviti di rumah! â­Cuba berikan arahan yang spesifik, realistik dan positif kepada anak anda. Adakah anda mempunyai masa untuk melakukannya pada hari ini? â°

SourceText: ğŸ‰That's great! Try to remember to praise your child whenever they follow your instruction. You can do it!
text: ğŸ‰Bagus! Teruskan memuji anak anda setiap kali mereka mengikut arahan anda. Anda boleh lakukannya!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER} is helping to create a bedtime routine with her daughter, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}. Letâ€™s see how they do it together!

SourceText: True or false: Family rules should be set by the parents because our children are too young to decide for themselves.
text: Betul atau salah: Peraturan keluarga perlu ditetapkan oleh ibu bapa kerana anak kita terlalu mentah untuk membuat keputusan sendiri.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} is spending too much time watching TV before his homework is finished. Letâ€™s see how his mother, {F1_MOTHER}, helps him create a family rule about this:
text: {F1_SON_5} menghabiskan banyak masa dengan menonton TV sebelum menyiapkan kerja sekolah. Mari kita lihat bagaimana ibunya, {F1_MOTHER}, membantunya dalam mencipta peraturan keluarga tentang masalah ini:

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: It is important that you get your homework done so you can do well in school. Letâ€™s make a rule about watching TV.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Kerja sekolah perlu disiapkan dan ini penting untuk kamu berjaya di sekolah. Kita perlu membuat peraturan tentang menonton TV.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Okay, Ibu.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Baik, Ibu.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: What do you think would be a fair rule?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Apa peraturan yang kamu rasa adil buat kamu?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Hmmmâ€¦well, maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Hmmmâ€¦kalau begitu, mungkin saya boleh menonton TV selama yang boleh, tetapi selepas saya siapkan kerja rumah.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: I like that idea, but letâ€™s limit it to 1 hour per day. How does that sound?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Idea yang menarik, tetapi mari kita hadkan kepada 1 jam sehari. Boleh?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} Fine.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Baik.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, {F1_SON_5}. Your grades have improved, too! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour and a half each dayâ€¦as long as you still do your homework first!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Terima kasih, {F1_SON_5} kerana menyiapkan kerja sekolah sebelum menonton TV. Gred kamu juga bertambah baik! Ibu sangat bangga dengan kamu! Kalau begini, Ibu boleh tambahkan masa menonton TV kepada 1 jam setengah setiap hari... asalkan kamu perlu menyiapkan kerja sekolah dahulu!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Thank you, Ibu!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Terima kasih, Ibu!

SourceText: This skill is about how we can keep control and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments. ğŸ’š

SourceText: ğŸŒ· We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: ğŸŒ· Kita sayangkan anak-anak kita, tetapi tekanan daripada menjaga mereka dan perkara-perkara lain boleh membuat kita marah. Inilah lumrah kehidupan!

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: ğŸ’¡ Penting bagi kita untuk mengawal dan mengurus kemarahan kita supaya kita tidak melukai orang lain.

SourceText: True or False: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
text: Betul atau Salah: Saya perlu menunjukkan kemarahan saya kepada anak saya supaya mereka berkelakuan baik.

SourceText: ğŸ’› It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything.
text: ğŸ’› Apabila anak anda berkelakuan buruk, keadaan boleh menjadi sangat sukar, tetapi sebelum anda melakukan apa-apa, anda harus cuba menguruskan tekanan dan mengawal kemarahan anda sendiri.

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
text: ğŸŒ± Apabila anda marah, anda mungkin berkata atau melakukan perkara yang anda akan menyesal kemudian. Anda boleh bertenang dengan menarik nafas dalam-dalam.

SourceText: â¡ï¸ You can also redirect or ignore negative behaviour without ignoring your child when they are making you angry.
text: â¡ï¸ Anda boleh mengalihkan atau mengabaikan tingkah laku negatif tanpa mengabaikan anak anda semasa mereka membuat anda marah.

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}â€™s mother, {F3_MOTHER} is concerned that {F3_SON_7} is sleeping late everyday because of unfinished homework. Letâ€™s see how they try to solve the problem together:
text: Ibu kepada {F3_SON_7}, {F3_MOTHER} berasa bimbang kerana {F3_SON_7} tidur lewat setiap hari kerana kerja sekolahnya belum siap. Mari kita lihat cara mereka menyelesaikan masalah ini bersama-sama:

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ KNOW IT
text: 1ï¸âƒ£ AMBIL TAHU

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Come on, {F3_SON_7}, it's time to get ready for bed.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Sudahlah, {F3_SON_7}, masa untuk tidur.

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: But I still have so much homework to do!
text: {F3_SON_7}: tapi kerja sekolah saya masih belum siap!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Hm, this is the third night in a row that you haven't got to bed on time because of homework.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Hm, malam ini sudah tiga malam berturut-turut kamu tidur lewat kerana menyiapkan kerja sekolah.

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ SOLVE IT
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ SELESAIKAN

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: How can we make sure you get all your work done and still get to bed on time?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Bagaimana kita boleh memastikan kerja sekolah kamu dapat disiapkan dan kamu boleh tidur tepat pada masanya?

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: Maybe I can start earlier?
text: {F3_SON_7}: Mungkin saya boleh bermula lebih awal?

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: How about we make a rule that you start your homework half an hour after you get home from school. That way, you can finish it and have some time to relax before bed, too! I am happy to help you a little bit.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Bagaimana jika kita buat peraturan untuk kamu memulakan kerja sekolah kamu setengah jam selepas kamu pulang dari sekolah. Dengan cara itu, kamu boleh menyiapkan kerja sekolah lebih awal dan ada sedikit masa untuk berehat sebelum tidur! Ibu juga gembira untuk membantu kamu.

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: Okay, Mummy.
text: {F3_SON_7}: Baik, Ibu.

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ TRY IT
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ CUBA

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: {F3_SON_7}, have you started your homework yet?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: {F3_SON_7}, kamu dah mula buat kerja sekolah kamu?

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: I'll start now, Mummy! Can I talk to you about this question?
text: {F3_SON_7}: Saya akan mulakan sekarang, Ibu! Boleh saya tanya ibu tentang soalan ini?

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Of course, boy.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Sudah tentu boleh.

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ TEST IT
text: 4ï¸âƒ£ UJI

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: Look, Mummy, I'm ready for bed so early tonight!
text: {F3_SON_7}: Wah, Ibu, saya dah sedia untuk tidur awal malam ini!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Well done, {F3_SON_7}. Thank you for working with me to find a solution that works. Now you can be well-rested for tomorrow!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} wants to help his young children learn about safe and unsafe touch. Lets see how he has the conversation with his young son, {F1_SON_5}.
text: {F1_FATHER} mahu membantu anak kecilnya belajar tentang sentuhan selamat dan sentuhan tidak selamat. Mari kita lihat cara dia berkomunikasi dengan anak terunanya, {F1_SON_5}.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Did you enjoy the story, {F1_SON_5}?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kamu suka tak cerita tadi, {F1_SON_5}?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Yes, Ayah! It was fun!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Ya, Ayah! Saya sangat seronok!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}:  Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.
text: {F1_FATHER}:  Sekarang Ayah nak cakap tentang beberapa perkara penting. Ia tentang menjaga keselamatan dan kesihatan diri.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: What do you mean, Ayah?
text: {F1_SON_5}: Apa maksudnya, Ayah?

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Pertama sekali, kita semua mempunyai anggota sulit pada tubuh kita. Anggota ini adalah anggota yang ditutup oleh pakaian dalam kita.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Like this?
text: {F1_SON_5}: Seperti ini?

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, and no one should touch them except to keep you clean and healthy.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Tepat sekali. Sesiapa pun tidak boleh menyentuh anggota sulit kamu kecuali untuk membersihkan dan untuk tujuan kesihatan, dan ini sangat penting untuk kamu ingat.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say 'no' if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kamu berhak untuk mengatakan 'tidak' sekiranya ada orang yang ingin menyentuh kamu dengan cara yang kamu tidak sukai, tubuh kamu adalah milik kamu.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Okay, Ayah.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Baik, Ayah.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me or Ibu. We're here to protect you and keep you safe.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kami sentiasa ada untuk melindungi kamu dan pastikan kamu selamat. Jadi, sekiranya terjadi apa-apa yang buat kamu rasa takut atau tidak selesa, kamu harus ingat bahawa kamu boleh beritahu kepada Ayah dan Ibu.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I will tell you and Ibu, Ayah.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Saya akan beritahu Ayah dan Ibu, Ayah.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I love you, {F1_SON_5}. Now, let's give each other a big hug!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Ayah sayangkan kamu, {F1_SON_5}. Sini, peluk Ayah erat-erat!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, and no one should touch them except to keep you clean and healthy.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Tepat sekali. Sesiapa pun tidak boleh menyentuh anggota sulit kamu kecuali untuk membersihkan dan untuk tujuan kesihatan, dan ini sangat penting untuk kamu ingat.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say 'no' if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kamu berhak untuk mengatakan 'tidak' sekiranya ada orang yang ingin menyentuh kamu dengan cara yang kamu tidak sukai, tubuh kamu adalah milik kamu.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me. Iâ€™m here to protect you and keep you safe.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kami sentiasa ada untuk melindungi kamu dan pastikan kamu selamat. Jadi, sekiranya terjadi apa-apa yang buat kamu rasa takut atau tidak selesa, kamu harus ingat bahawa kamu boleh beritahu kepada Ayah dan Ibu.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: I will tell you, Mummy.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Saya akan beritahu, Ibu.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: I love you, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Now, let's give each other a big hug!
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Saya sayangkan kamu, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Mari peluk Ibu!

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Oh dear, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}, that is not OK. Thank you for telling me about it, that is not okay.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: If he ever tries to give you a hug again, you can tell him, â€œNo, letâ€™s rather shake hands,â€ and tell me straight away. Shall we practise?

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Well done, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}. I love you very much and Iâ€™m so glad you spoke to me about it. If Uncle makes you feel uncomfortable again, you must tell me immediately. You should always feel safe and comfortable with the people around you.

SourceText: This skill is about learning how to respond when our children are in crisis.â—
text: Kemahiran ini adalah untuk belajar cara bertindak balas semasa anak kita berdepan dengan krisis. â—

SourceText: When our children share something that is very hard or upsetting to themğŸ˜”ğŸ˜£, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open, so that they feel supported. ğŸ’›
text: Semasa anak kita berkongsi kesukaran dan perkara yang membuatkannya kecewa ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜£, ingatlah untuk kekal tenang, mendengar dengan baik, dan bersikap terbuka supaya dia rasa disokong. ğŸ’›

SourceText: True or False: When my child is upset, I should wait for them to come to me. I donâ€™t want to upset them further by asking what is troubling them.
text: Betul atau Salah: Semasa anak saya berasa kecewa, saya tidak mahu terus mengganggunya dengan bertanya masalahnya. Saya patut tunggu anak saya datang kepada saya.

SourceText: ğŸ˜£ When children are in crisis, they may fear telling others about it for many reasons. They may be worried about others judging them or getting angry. They may also feel shame.
text: ğŸ˜£ Anak-anak mempunyai banyak sebab mengapa mereka takut untuk bercerita, terutama semasa menghadapi krisis. Mereka mungkin takut dimarahi atau dihakimi. Mungkin mereka juga berasa malu.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Assure them that you are proud of how brave they are to share their crisis with you.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} looks upset. Letâ€™s see how his father, {F1_FATHER} responds:
text: {F1_SON_5} nampak kecewa. Mari lihat bagaimana ayahnya, {F1_FATHER} bertindak balas:

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I don't want to play with Aiman today.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Saya tak nak bermain dengan Aiman hari ini.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: What happened, {F1_SON_5}? I thought you and Aiman were friends. Do you want to talk about it?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kenapa, {F1_SON_5}? Ayah ingat kamu dan Aiman berkawan baik. Cuba beritahu Ayah, ada apa sebenarnya?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} (crying): He and some of the other kids were mean to me. They said I was stupid because I canâ€™t button my shirt properly.
text: {F1_SON_5} (menangis): Aiman dan kawan-kawan lain membuli saya. Mereka cakap saya bodoh kerana saya tak pandai memasang butang baju saya sendiri.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} : Oh my {F1_SON_5}, that is not a very nice thing to say to anyone. I can understand why you would feel upset about this.
text: {F1_FATHER} : Anakku {F1_SON_5}, itu adalah kata-kata yang tak baik untuk dicakapkan kepada orang lain. Ayah faham sebab kamu berasa marah.

SourceText: First of all, you are not stupid! I am so proud about how much you are growing and learning. It is important that Aiman and the others know that it is not okay to say mean things. Would you like me to come with you so that we can have a chat with the others together?
text: Pertama sekali, kamu kene tahu yang kamu tak bodoh. Ayah bangga melihat kamu membesar dan belajar dengan baik. Tapi Aiman dan rakan-rakan Aiman yang lain perlu tahu bahawa kita tidak boleh bercakap perkara yang tidak baik. Kamu nak Ayah ikut kamu tak? Supaya Ayah boleh bercakap dengan Aiman dan rakan-rakan kamu yang lain bersama-sama?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Okayâ€¦
text: {F1_SON_5}: Okeyâ€¦

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I can also have a chat with Aiman's parents to let them know. Aiman is a good boy and is usually nice to you so maybe there is something else happening.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Ayah juga boleh bercakap dengan ibu bapa Aiman dan memberitahu mereka apa yang terjadi. Aiman tu budak baik, dan biasanya dia baik dengan kamu, jadi mungkin ada perkara lain yang berlaku.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing with me, {F1_SON_5}. I am very proud of you.
text: Terima kasih kerana berkongsi dengan Ayah, {F1_SON_5}. Ayah bangga dengan kamu.

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ Here are four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you:
text: 4ï¸âƒ£ Berikut adalah empat perkara yang boleh anda lakukan untuk menyokong anak anda apabila dia berkongsi kesukarannya dengan anda:

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ BREATHE: Take a pause

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Let your child share with you what they need. Sometimes, your child might be comfortable sharing by drawing.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Notice what they are feeling and tell them what you notice so they feel heard.

SourceText: ğŸ’™ Tell your child that you are there for them and love them.

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ COMFORT: Be there for your child
text: 4ï¸âƒ£ MENENANGKAN: Sentiasa ada untuk anak anda

SourceText: ğŸŒ· It can be hard to see your child feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.

SourceText: ğŸ”„In these moments, maintaining a consistent routine can be particularly helpful. Familiar routines can provide a sense of security and normalcy, helping your child feel safe again.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} wants to watch videos on the handphone. Her mother, {F3_MOTHER}, uses this opportunity to teach {F3_DAUGHTER_4} about how to stay safe online:
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} mahu menonton video di telefon bimbit. Ibunya, {F3_MOTHER}, menggunakan peluang ini untuk mengajar {F3_DAUGHTER_4} tentang keselamatan semasa berada dalam talian:

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Can I use the phone to play games?
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Boleh saya pinjam telefon untuk bermain permainan video?

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Sure! But letâ€™s first learn how to be safe when using gadgets. First, the household rule is that you can only use gadgets for 30 minutes each day. I will set a timer that will go off when you have 5 minutes left.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Boleh! Tapi mula-mula kita belajar macam mana kita nak menggunakan gajet dengan selamat. Peraturan pertama, kamu boleh gunakan gajet selama 30 minit sahaja setiap hari. Ibu akan tetapkan pemasa yang akan berbunyi 5 minit sebelum masa tamat.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Also, always ask Mummy for permission before using any device. You should also only play games or watch videos that we have approved, okay?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kamu juga harus minta izin daripada Ibu terlebih dahulu sebelum menggunakan apa-apa peranti. Kamu hanya boleh bermain permainan atau menonton video yang kita dah setuju sahaja, ya?

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay, Mummy!
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Baik, Ibu!

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Can I create my own account for pictures and videos, Mummy? Audrey has an account for herself.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Boleh tak kalau saya buka akaun saya sendiri untuk gambar dan video, Ibu? Audrey ada akaun sendiri.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Not just yet, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Social media is for older kids. We'll wait until you're a bit older. But we can post pictures on my account together if you want.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Belum boleh lagi, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Media sosial sesuai untuk remaja. Kita tunggu kamu besar sikit ya. Tapi kalau kamu nak siarkan gambar, kamu boleh sama-sama gunakan akaun Ibu.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe!
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Jangan sekali-kali mengklik tetingkap timbul atau gambar jika ia muncul. Jika ada perkara yang buat kamu rasa terganggu, beritahu Mummy serta-merta. Kami sentiasa ada untuk memastikan keselamatan kamu!

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Thank you, Mummy!
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Terima kasih, Ibu!

SourceText: ğŸš© CONTENT: Your child might come across harmful content, such as violence, hateful speech, pornography, wrong information, or hating women, people with disabilities, or other races, religions, sexualities, or from other countries.

SourceText: ğŸš© CONDUCT: Sometimes, children or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: That sounds great. Thank you for cooking dinner, my dear!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Itu cadangan yang baik. Terima kasih kerana masakkan makan malam, sayang!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I am grateful we can talk about this and make this decision together. It makes a lot more sense to try to get it repaired first.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Me too. I feel a lot better now that we have talked about it together.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Saya juga. Saya rasa lebih lega sekarang kerana kita telah berbincang tentang hal ini bersama-sama.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER} has big hopes for her childrenâ€™s futures and she is making a plan:
text: {F3_MOTHER} sedang membuat perancangan kerana dia mempunyai harapan besar untuk masa depan anak-anaknya:

SourceText: "I want the best future for my children, but I donâ€™t know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. I should save, but that feels impossible!"
text: "Saya inginkan anak-anak saya berjaya di masa depan, tetapi saya tidak tahu cara untuk mencari wang. Ahlong sangat berbahaya dan bunga yang dikenakan sangat tinggi. Patutnya saya menyimpan, tapi macam mustahil untuk saya lakukan!"

SourceText: "My goal is to make sure my children reach their dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?"
text: "Matlamat saya adalah supaya anak-anak saya mencapai impian mereka ke universiti. Bagaimana saya boleh menyimpan dengan banyak jika duit yang saya ada pun sangat sedikit?"

SourceText: "I know - letâ€™s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget â€“ a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time â€“ I will even join a savings and loans group."
text: "Saya tahu - mari mulakan dengan merancang! Pertama, biar saya sediakan belanjawan â€“ rancangan bagaimana saya boleh menyimpan wang. Kemudian, saya akan menyimpan sedikit wang pada satu-satu masa â€“ dan saya juga akan menyertai kumpulan simpanan dan pinjaman."

SourceText: "I should also speak with my children to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but donâ€™t need."
text: "Saya perlu bercakap dengan anak-anak saya untuk memilih perkara-perkara yang boleh dikurangkan sedikit belanja pada setiap minggu. Mereka akan membantu saya untuk memikirkan barang-barang yang kami mahu tetapi tidak perlu."

SourceText: In the future: "Look, we reached our dreams! I didnâ€™t borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for {F3_DAUGHTER_4}â€™s college fees and save some money for {F3_SON_7}â€™s university. I am so proud of this.â€
text: Di masa depan: "Lihat, kita telah mencapai impian kita! Saya tidak meminjam wang daripada kawan atau pun ahlong. Saya menyimpan sedikit demi sedikit setiap minggu, dan saya berjaya membayar yuran kolej {F3_DAUGHTER_4} dan juga menyimpan sedikit wang untuk yuran universiti {F3_SON_7}. Saya berasa sangat bangga.â€

SourceText: Press play to learn 5 tips for making a savings plan for you and your child:
text: Tekan butang main untuk belajar 5 petua tentang membuat rancangan simpanan bagi anda dan anak anda:

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ WHY SAVE
text: 1ï¸âƒ£ MENGAPA MENYIMPAN

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ HOW TO SAVE
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ BAGAIMANA MAHU MENYIMPAN

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ WHERE TO SAVE
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ DI MANA MAHU MENYIMPAN

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are five tips on how to make a savings plan for you and your child:
text: 5ï¸âƒ£ Berikut adalah lima petua tentang cara untuk membuat perancangan simpanan untuk anda dan anak anda:

SourceText: Decide why you want to save money. These could include:
text: Cari sebab mengapa anda perlu menyimpan wang. Ini mungkin termasuk:

SourceText: ğŸ˜”Preparing for emergencies
text: ğŸ˜”Persediaan menghadapi kecemasan

SourceText: ğŸ Buying something nice for you or your child or do something fun as a family
text: ğŸ Membeli hadiah untuk diri sendiri atau anak anda atau untuk berseronok bersama keluarga

SourceText: ğŸ“– Planning for future big expenses like improvements on your home or for your childâ€™s education
text: ğŸ“– Merancang perbelanjaan besar pada masa hadapan seperti pengubahsuaian rumah, atau untuk pendidikan anak anda

SourceText: ğŸš© Set a target amount that you want to save.
text: ğŸš© Tentukan jumlah sasaran yang anda ingin simpan.

SourceText: ğŸ’° Look at your monthly budget and decide how much you can save each week and each month.
text: ğŸ’° Putuskan jumlah simpanan anda bagi setiap minggu dan bulan dengan melihat kepada belanjawan bulanan anda.

SourceText: Consider the different ways to keep money safe for future use. These could include:
text: Pertimbangkan cara yang berbeza untuk menyimpan wang di masa depan. Ini mungkin termasuk:

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ Saving at a bank
text: ğŸ”‘ Simpan wang di bank

SourceText: ğŸ’š Keeping money safe at home
text: ğŸ’š Simpan wang dengan selamat di rumah

SourceText: ğŸ’° Keeping money in a savings and loan group
text: ğŸ’° Simpan wang dalam kumpulan simpanan atau pinjaman

SourceText: ğŸŒ· Buying livestock like goats or cattle
text: ğŸŒ· Beli ternakan seperti kambing atau lembu

SourceText: Decide which way of saving money would work best for the family.
text: Tentukan cara simpanan mana yang paling berkesan untuk keluarga anda.

SourceText: â— If you can try and save even a tiny amount for the future or for an emergency. This can make a big difference over time.
text: â— Jika anda boleh cuba berjimat walaupun dengan jumlah yang sedikit untuk kegunaan kecemasan atau masa depan. Tabung kecemasan ini boleh membawa perubahan besar secara beransur-ansur.

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need.
text: ğŸŒ± Organisasi kerajaan atau komuniti anda mungkin ada menyumbang wang, baucar, atau bungkusan makanan kepada keluarga yang memerlukan.

SourceText: ğŸ’› Think about whether there are places in your community that provide support.
text: ğŸ’› Fikirkan sama ada terdapat tempat dalam komuniti anda yang menawarkan bantuan.

SourceText: Home Activity! â­ Itâ€™s time to create your savings plan. Do you have time to do it today?
text: Aktiviti di Rumah! â­ Sudah tiba masanya untuk anda merancang simpanan di hari tua anda. Adakah anda mempunyai masa untuk lakukannya hari ini?
